text: I had a very thick hair by birth, but I lost a lot of it during my graduation. I did not took good care of it. At a point, it was too thin. Then I realised and started taking care of it. text:
Someone has never actually compared ingredient labels and it shows. There are so many "high end" products that use the exact same ingredients as drugstore products. 

Cosmetic chemists have debunked the "salon products are better" myths over and over again but stylists keep perpetuating the myths because they make commissions for each product they sell.
author: @justanotherjessica

text: ¬†@justanotherjessica¬† Nope, most drugstore products cause hair to become oily faster, making you have to wash your hair daily and use more product. Paying more and getting better quality actually saves you money.
